page.title: 17Headlands School
page.content: Headlands Secondary School is the largest school in North East Swindon.It was formed in 1983,when Headlands senior high school,Penhill and Pinehurst junior high schools were merged to form one 11-16 comprehensive school.To start with there were 1600 pupils,but the school no longer has a sixth form as a new sixth form college has been established to take sixth formers from all over Swindon.The school is on two sites with three different buildings.The lower school (first and second years)occupies the old Penhill site,and the third, fourth and fifth years are in the Headlands building half a mile down Cricklade Road.The teachers have to use their own cars or taxis to travel from one building to another.
